image.altText: People stand at the water's edge to watch fireworks.

props.synopsis: It happens just once a year, for five loud, chaotic hours — and only in one rebellious corner of the country. See how the Northern Territory celebrated Cracker Night in pictures.

title.children: 'The Wild West': The Northern Territory's Cracker Night in pictures

image.altText: A bearded man in a red shirt standing in a doorway

props.synopsis: Northern Territory retailers are warning of business closures and job losses amid a delayed crackdown on a controversial Centrelink payment system that advocates say exploits remote Aboriginal customers.

title.children: Remote retailers facing 'collapse' amid Centrepay crackdown

image.altText: A man in a lab coat holds up a pair of sample jars containing soil.

props.synopsis: The soil-borne disease continues to pose a threat in Queensland's north following extremely wet conditions this year.

title.children: Another melioidosis case recorded in northern Australia as two more deaths confirmed

image.altText: A waterfall on a rocky landscape, with green trees growing on all sides of the water.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's popular Litchfield National Park is set to expand by 20 per cent, giving Territorians and visitors more places to camp, four-wheel drive, swim and hunt.

title.children: Popular waterfalls to join Litchfield National Park in 30,000ha expansion

image.altText: Three poker machines in a club with brightly coloured screens showing different gambling games, with three empty stools in front

props.synopsis: Not-for-profit pokies clubs in the Northern Territory are supposed to contribute part of their profits for the benefit of the wider community, but data shows some are effectively opting out of the voluntary scheme.

title.children: Clubs accused of 'whitewashing' pokies revenue through benefit scheme

image.altText: Water over road sign as car splashes water

props.synopsis: Parts of the New South Wales Central and South coasts are being lashed by a coastal low weather system that is causing damaging winds and heavy rainfall. Follow live.

title.children: Power cuts, flights cancelled, homes impacted as wild weather hits NSW

image.altText: a tree across rail lines in front of a train after it fell due to strong winds

props.synopsis: Strong winds and fallen trees cause major transport disruptions as the "complex weather system" continues to move further inland in NSW.

title.children: SES carries out two flood rescues, tree 'crashes through train windscreen'

image.altText: A big tree fallen down on a suburban road on a cloudy day.

props.synopsis: Multiple emergency warnings from NSW SES remain in place between the South Coast and Central Coast, in the aftermath of powerful winds and heavy rain.

title.children: 'Avoid unnecessary travel': Heavy rain and wind smashes NSW coast

image.altText: Smoke billows from a volcano rising from tropical rainforest.

props.synopsis: The worker's potentially illegal employment was among numerous issues uncovered by a comprehensive audit of the Shire of Coolgardie's books.

title.children: Outback council staffer was working from Caribbean island, audit finds

image.altText: Street lights and car lights glow in a night scene

props.synopsis: Commuters on Perth roads are having to drive in pitch-black conditions after copper thieves strip wiring from the network, causing headaches for authorities.

title.children: Authorities struggle to clamp down on copper theft on Perth roads

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie poses with a Russian passport in front of a Russian crest.

props.synopsis: A Russian-backed organisation that has bankrolled the legal defence of alleged spies and criminals has been sanctioned by the federal government just weeks after an investigation detailed its support for Australia's most prominent pro-Putin propagandist.

title.children: Russia-backed fund that bankrolled 'Aussie Cossack' sanctioned by Australia

image.altText: Miles Bergman shares a hug with Willie Rioli

props.synopsis: Miles Bergan signs a new deal to remain with Port Adelaide in the midst of a breakout season playing in a new midfield role.

title.children: 'We can go a long way': In-demand Port star rejects rivals to sign new deal

image.altText: A girl with blue eyes and smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Police say they have charged a 30-year-old man with two counts of accessory after the fact to murder.

title.children: Third person charged in relation to alleged murder of Pheobe Bishop

image.altText: Donald Trump inspects beds behind fencing.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is threatening to send unauthorised migrants to a prison camp surrounded by alligators in his latest move to expel "illegal aliens" from the US.

title.children: 'Cops in the form of alligators': Trump's new threat to unauthorised migrants

image.altText: People recline on marble steps outside the US Captiol. The building's domed roof can be seen in the bakground

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump is getting closer to seeing his One Big Beautiful Bill Act passed after it narrowly passed a Senate vote. Here's why the bill isn't enjoying full Republican support.

title.children: Why Republicans are voting against Trump's Big Beautiful Bill

image.altText: A traditional-looking housewife smiles at the camera as she holds a pie standing in a pink-coloured pantry

props.synopsis: What is it about the tradwife movement and its strict traditional gender roles that has struck a chord with modern day mothers?

title.children: These modern stay-at-home mums are redefining what it means to be a tradwife

image.altText: A man in a suit looks on at a share market board filled with red as the ASX 200 falls.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is gaining solidly, despite a fall for Qantas as the airline reveals customer data was accessed in a cyber attack. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX gains despite Qantas shares dipping on data hack

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Helia shares tumble on ING contract loss
ASX on the rise after lunchtime dip

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt talks with an older woman in grey while standing against a blue background with "tasinsure" branding.

props.synopsis: The insurance market "has failed Tasmanians", Premier Jeremy Rockliff says, as the Liberal Party makes an election pitch to create a new state-owned insurance company.

title.children: Tasmanian Liberals promise new state-owned insurance company

props.synopsis: As the world waits to see if Donald Trump's talks will go ahead, look back at how previous US presidents have handled Iran.

title.children: The US helped start Iran's nuclear program — but now wants to end it

image.altText: A false-colour map showing a wind forecast, with strong winds directed towards the NSW coast.

props.synopsis: The effect of the NSW "bomb cyclone" is being felt in parts of the Sunshine State.

title.children: Fallout of 'bomb cyclone' sees flights cancelled, destructive winds hit Qld

image.altText: An illustration of line graphics surrounding a mobile phone tower.

props.synopsis: Spectrum worth billions of dollars is likely to be rolled over to existing holders rather than auctioned, potentially costing taxpayers billions and the chance of increased competition in telecommunications, critics say.

title.children: $3.2 billion taxpayer 'gift' for telcos including Telstra and Optus

image.altText: Peter Dutton in Hobart, tasting wine at winery. Seat of Lyons

props.synopsis: Assuming Liberal leader Sussan Ley takes a COMCAR to Parliament House, the rest of the Liberal women can get there in a Corolla.

title.children: No matter the number, the Liberals' script on women stays the same

image.altText: Sean Combs wears a black jacket and white tie.

props.synopsis: The jury at Sean "Diddy" Combs's sex trafficking trial reaches verdicts on four of the five counts the music mogul faces, but cannot agree on the most serious charge of racketeering conspiracy.

title.children: Diddy jury reaches partial verdict but deadlocked on racketeering charge

image.altText: A street with cars and buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: Morwell has played host to Erin Patterson's murder trial for the past nine weeks. Here's what it's been like in the regional Victorian town.

title.children: When the world is watching one town and its courtroom, what happens?

image.altText: Zohran Mamdani

props.synopsis: "There's a real assembly line for incoming politicians that has changed the nature of the kinds of people that get elected," a political academic tells the ABC.

title.children: Mamdani broke through America's political establishment. That's harder to do in Australia

image.altText: Six women in blue and white volleyball uniforms and one in red and white stand in circle crouched down with their arms out.

props.synopsis: The Cuban women's volleyball team has been denied entry into Puerto Rico due to new visa restrictions that could impact future tournaments.

title.children: Cuba's volleyball team blocked from US due to new visa restrictions

image.altText: A woman walking past a house on fire at night.

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin also speaks with his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron for the first time since 2022.

title.children: Russia denies US claims it is trying to 'stall' Ukraine peace negotiations

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Cheshire Police says the investigation into corporate manslaughter offences does not have any impact on Lucy Letby's 2023 convictions for murder and attempted murder.

title.children: Police arrest hospital bosses where killer nurse Lucy Letby worked

image.altText: A man in a bloody green tracksuit sits handcuffed to a bed

props.synopsis: Korean TV is now the most-viewed non-US content on Netflix. Now Squid Game is finished, try diving into some of these other great K dramas.

title.children: There is so much more to K-drama than Squid Game. Here are our favourites

image.altText: A man sits in a paddock with his calves.

props.synopsis: Farmers and animal advocates say the ordinary person's obligations when dealing with animals are unclear under Western Australian law, leaving them vulnerable to legal risks.

title.children: Why WA's 'grey' animal welfare laws have experts increasingly worried

image.altText: A figure with two dogs in the distance, walking on the beach.

props.synopsis: Vets warn pet owners about visiting a north Queensland beach as council investigates the cause of a "tragic" string of dog deaths.

title.children: Three dogs die after visiting popular Townsville beach

image.altText: a brunette woman wearing a white blazer

props.synopsis: It is alleged the then 16-year-old stabbed Vyleen White in a supermarket car park south-west of Brisbane before stealing her car.

title.children: Teen accused of murdering grandmother expected to enter plea

image.altText: Dishwasher stacked with dishes after being rinsed first

props.synopsis: New research has found cleaning plastic containers in the dishwasher is actually a source of microplastic pollution.

title.children: Average dishwasher found to release 33 million microplastic particles per year

image.altText: A dingo eats from a jar of peanut butter while lying in some long grass.

props.synopsis: Rangers on the World Heritage-listed island off Queensland's coast urge visitors to secure their food, bait and rubbish from dingoes.

title.children: Belongings destroyed as K'gari rangers warn of four-legged thieves
